bunpro.meaning: Won't, Intend not to, Probably not
bunpro.meaning_warning: する→しまい/するまい/すまい・くる→きまい/くるまい/こまい
bunpro.writeup: Theauxiliary verbまいis used in Japanese to express negative volition. This means that in many ways, it is the opposite of う and よう, which are theauxiliary verbsthat express positive volition.まいconnects to the base form of verbs, and is considered slightly formal.まい may be translated as 'won't (A)', 'to intend not to (A)', or 'probably not (A)'. It can be considered as a condensed way of expressing 〜ないだろう.Caution - When appearing with する or来る, it is also common to seeまいconnected to theconjunctive formasしまい,すまい,きまいandこまい. However, the standardするまいand来るまいare also quite common structures.

examples.japanese: あんな接客が雑なレストランにはもう行くまい。
examples.english: I probably won't go back to that restaurant with such poor customer service.

examples.japanese: あのアパートの家賃は高いので、あそこには住むまい。
examples.english: The rent for that apartment is expensive, so I probably won't live there.

examples.japanese: 田中くんはとてもいい人なので、そんなひどい事はしまい。
examples.english: Since Tanaka-kun is a nice person, he probably wouldn't do such a terrible thing.

examples.japanese: 台風の警報が出ているので、今日中に届くはずだった荷物はこまい。
examples.english: Since there was a warning announced for the typhoon, I probably won't get the package that I was expecting today.

examples.japanese: 昨日飲みすぎてしまったので、二度と酒は飲むまい。
examples.english: Because I drank too much last night, I don't intend to drink ever again.

examples.japanese: 今日は火曜日だから、あのダンスクラブにはお客さんがおるまい。
examples.english: Because it is Tuesday, there probably won't be many people at that dance club.

examples.japanese: この車の見た目からすると安くはあるまい。
examples.english: Judging from the appearance of this car, it is probably not cheap.

examples.japanese: 私のせいでものすごい苦情だ。もう失敗するまい。
examples.english: I caused the terrible grievances. I intend not to fail again.

examples.japanese: あの店は行列がすごすぎる。もう行くまい。
examples.english: The line at that shop is too crazy. I probably won't go again.

dojg.description: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
dojg.meaning: Will not; will probably not; be probably not

examples.japanese: (ksa).もう橋本には何も頼むまい。
examples.english: I  will not ask any more favours of Hashimoto.

examples.japanese: (ksb).これは恐らく誰も気が付くまい。
examples.english: Probably  no one will notice this.

examples.japanese: (ksc).参加者はそれほど多くはあるまい。
examples.english: There  probably won't be many participants.

examples.japanese: (ksd).この教え方はあまり効果的ではあるまい。
examples.english: This  teaching method is probably not very effective.

examples.japanese: (kse).これは何かの間違いではあるまいか。
examples.english: I  have a feeling that this is some kind of mistake. (literally: Is this not some  kind of mistake?)

examples.japanese: (a).清のパーティーにはもう行くまい。
examples.english: I  will not go to Kiyoshi's parties any more.

examples.japanese: (b).日本へ行こうか行くまいか迷った。
examples.english: I  couldn't decide whether I should go to Japan or not.

examples.japanese: (c).彼は多分誰の言うことも聞くまい。
examples.english: He  probably won't listen to anyone.

examples.japanese: (d).それは今我々には必要ではあるまい。
examples.english: It  is probably not necessary for us now.

examples.japanese: (e).この問題はこの学校の学生にはそれほど難しくはあるまい。
examples.english: This  problem is probably not very difficult for these students.

examples.japanese: (f).ジョージが真相を知っているのではあるまいか。
examples.english: I  have a feeling that George knows the truth.

dojg.formation:
## 

- (i)Vinformal nonpast
- まい
- 行くまい
- (I) will not go; probably won’t go
- 教えるまい
- (I) will not teach; probably won’t teach
- (ii)Adjective い stem
- くはあるまい
- 高くはあるまい
- Something is probably not expensive
- (iii){Adjective な stem/Noun}
- ではあるまい
- 静かではあるまい
- Something is probably not quiet
- 先生ではあるまい
- Someone is probably not a teacher
dojg.part_of_speech: Auxiliary (used in writing and formal speech only)
